titles.title: Compassionate Assistance for Parents with Children with Special Needs Act of 2004

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide that the medical expenses of a child with special needs shall be allowable as a medical expense deduction without regard to the 7.5 percent adjusted gross income threshold.
Compassionate Assistance for Parents with Children with Special Needs Act of 2004

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: Compassionate Assistance for Parents with Children with Special Needs Act of 2004 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide that the medical expenses of disabled children under the age of 18 shall be tax deductible without regard to the 7.5 percent adjusted gross income threshold .
